page.title: 05THE CHURCH , WINSTONE
page.content: In Winstone the church is on the SE outskirts of the village. It is called St Bartholomew's.Built after the Norman Conquest, it is very plain compared with other churches.Inside about 70 people can be seated and on each pew are beautifully decorated kneeling cushions .At one end of the church is a 15th Century font and in the saddleback tower are three bells,two of which are Medieval. As you enter the churchyard there is an ornate gate with a lamp above. The graveyard contains a 14th Century Stone cross .The setting is typically Medieval with the Manor Hall next door (now Manor Farm,converted into 3 cottages). At the other end of the village is a Baptist Chapel which people said was well attended.
